ARABIC: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When they returned to their families, they would make a joke of them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And when they went back to their people turned to make fun of them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and when they went back to their families, they went back jesting,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and, on returning to their people, boast about what they had done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And whilst returning to their homes, they used to return rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when they returned to their own people, they would return jesting;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when they returned to their own followers they returned exulting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and when they returned to their people they returned blithely,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when they returned to their own folk, they returned jesting;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and when they returned to their own people, they would speak of them jestingly;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when they returned to their household they returned jesting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and when they returned to their folks they would return amused,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And when they returned to their own people, they would return jesting;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when they returned to their own people, they would return jesting;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When they returned to their people they returned jesting;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And when they went back to their families, they would go back exulting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [83:31] and when they returned to their folks they would return blithely (fākihīna: a variant reading has fakihīna), rejoicing in their [disparaging] mention of the believers;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when they) the disbelievers (returned to their own folk, they returned jesting) they returned happy with their idolatry and mocking the believers;
